title: Designing and drawing a Bezier Path
This example shows the process from designing the shape you want to drawing it on a view. A specific shap is used but the concepts you learn can be applied to any shape.

inline_content.Text: This example shows the process from designing the shape you want to drawing it on a view. A specific shap is used but the concepts you learn can be applied to any shape.

title: Design the outline of the shape you want.

inline_content.Text: Design the outline of the shape you want.

title: Divide the outline path into segments of lines, arcs, and curves.

inline_content.Text: Divide the outline path into segments of lines, arcs, and curves.

title: You could do anything, but as an example I have chosen the shape below. It could be a popup key on a keyboard.

inline_content.Text: You could do anything, but as an example I have chosen the shape below. It could be a popup key on a keyboard.

title: Look back at your shape design and break it down into simpler elements of lines (for straight lines), arcs (for circles and round corners), and curves (for anything else).

inline_content.Text: Look back at your shape design and break it down into simpler elements of lines (for straight lines), arcs (for circles and round corners), and curves (for anything else).

title: Here is what our example design would look like:

inline_content.Text: Here is what our example design would look like:

title: Orange dots are the control points for the curves

inline_content.Text: Orange dots are the control points for the curves

title: Green dots are the points between path segments

inline_content.Text: Green dots are the points between path segments

title: Dotted lines show the bounding rectangle

inline_content.Text: Dotted lines show the bounding rectangle

title: Dark blue numbers are the segments in the order that they will be added programmatically

inline_content.Text: Dark blue numbers are the segments in the order that they will be added programmatically

title: We’ll arbitrarily start in the bottom left corner and work clockwise. I’ll use the grid in the image to get the x and y values for the points. I’ll hardcode everything here, but of course you wouldn’t do that in a real project.

inline_content.Text: We’ll arbitrarily start in the bottom left corner and work clockwise. I’ll use the grid in the image to get the x and y values for the points. I’ll hardcode everything here, but of course you wouldn’t do that in a real project.

title: In your actual projects you probably shouldn’t use hard coded numbers, but rather get the sizes from your view’s bounds.
